Protoss](#Vs._Protoss) * [4.3 Vs. Terran](#Vs._Terran) * [4.4 Vs. Zerg](#Vs._Zerg) * [5 Quotes](#Quotes) * [6 Patch Changes](#Patch_Changes) * [7 External Links](#External_Links) * [8 References](#References) Description\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Adept&action=edit§ion=1 "Edit section: Description")\ \] ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- **Adepts** are "highly trained battlefield commanders", warped in at the [Gateway](/starcraft2/Gateway "Gateway") after the [Cybernetics Core](/starcraft2/Cybernetics_Core "Cybernetics Core") has finished. They were first introduced in [Legacy of the Void](/starcraft2/Legacy_of_the_Void "Legacy of the Void") . Despite their low rate of fire, Adepts can punch a hole through [Lightly](/starcraft2/Light "Light") \-armored targets. In addition, they can project a [Shade](/starcraft2/Psionic_Transfer "Psionic Transfer") of themselves, a controllable copy of the Adept that is immune but which exists for a brief time. Once this timer is up, the original Adept will teleport to the location of the shade, or the shade can be cancelled and preserve the location of the Adept. Due to the speed and immortality of the shade, this makes for an ideal scout. The ability can also be used for more offensive purposes. If the shade(s) are sent into the base of an opponent, it may require the opponent to split their army to deal with the possibility of the shade(s) expiring and the Adepts dealing damage. If Adepts are used for extensive damage-dealing, it may be desirable to research the [Resonating Glaives](/starcraft2/Resonating_Glaives "Resonating Glaives") upgrade from the Twilight Council, increasing Adept attack speed. Two defining features of developed armies in Starcraft are either they are extremely mobile but lacking power or powerful with less mobility. Two Stargate units the [Phoenix](/starcraft2/Phoenix "Phoenix") and [Oracle](/starcraft2/Oracle "Oracle") can harass where Adepts cannot, all three combined are even capable of defending almost all threats from both Terran and Zerg from the early to mid game. See Versus Protoss for why Adepts are not common there. Adepts have no anti-air attack and are commonly produced alongside [Stargate](/starcraft2/Stargate "Stargate") units like a few [Oracles](/starcraft2/Oracle "Oracle") and many [Phoenix](/starcraft2/Phoenix "Phoenix") . Phoenixes can control the opponent's air units, and their harassment, while also having the [Graviton Beam](/starcraft2/Graviton_Beam "Graviton Beam") ability to remove [Armored](/starcraft2/Armored "Armored") units into the air and leave the [Light](/starcraft2/Light "Light") units to be cleared up by the Adept's bonus damage. Most common against Zerg and Terran. Spells\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Adept&action=edit§ion=2 "Edit section: Spells")\ \] ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- [Psionic Transfer](/starcraft2/Psionic_Transfer "Psionic Transfer") | | | | --- | --- | | [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/8/86/Psionic_Transfer.png)](/starcraft2/File:Psionic_Transfer.png) | **Caster:** Adept

**[Cooldown](/starcraft2/Cooldown "Cooldown")
:** 11 s

**[Duration](/starcraft2/Game_Speed "Game Speed")
:** 7 s

**[Hotkey](/starcraft2/Hotkeys_per_Race "Hotkeys per Race")
:** F

Projects an invulnerable Shade that can move but cannot attack. After 7 seconds, the Adept teleports to the Shade's location. | The Shade moves faster than the Adept unit and can be selected and controlled. Shades can pass through units and [Force Fields](/starcraft2/Force_Field "Force Field") , but not buildings or other Shades. The Psionic transfer ability can be cancelled at any time before the teleport, when either unit is selected: when cancelled, the Shade disappears and the Adept stays in place and does not teleport. Increases the Adept's shields by 50. | Competitive Use\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Adept&action=edit§ion=5 "Edit section: Competitive Use")\ \] ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- ### General\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Adept&action=edit§ion=6 "Edit section: General")\ \] * Adepts are fast and good at harassing workers, which have the light tag and take bonus damage. They can shade around to vulnerable parts of the mineral line. * They can be combined with other harassment units such as a [Warp Prism](/starcraft2/Warp_Prism "Warp Prism") or some [Oracles](/starcraft2/Oracle "Oracle") in the early game to be able to pressure and harass two locations at the same time. A Warp Prism also gives an early [Warpgate](/starcraft2/Warpgate "Warpgate") research timing for Adepts if the opponent has teched too hard or too greedy. * Compared to the [Stalker](/starcraft2/Stalker "Stalker") , the other ranged [Gateway](/starcraft2/Gateway "Gateway") unit, the Adept tends to do better in the early game with its bonus against light units and low gas cost, whereas the Stalker does better in the midgame because it is more durable and can hit air units, amongst other reasons. * For example, Adepts combine well with the [Sentry](/starcraft2/Sentry "Sentry") 's [Forcefield](/starcraft2/Force_Field "Force Field") ability for defense against Ground unit rushes, due to the Adept's lower gas cost. It may be possible to defend off of [Gateways](/starcraft2/Gateway "Gateway") alone, depending on the size of the ramp you wish to defend. This effect is enhanced when [Warpgate](/starcraft2/Warpgate "Warpgate") research is finished and was used in Wings of Liberty against a [Stalker](/starcraft2/Stalker "Stalker") \-based 4 Warpgate Rush to buy time for [Immortals](/starcraft2/Immortal "Immortal") . * However, Adepts still cost less gas than stalkers, and as always Adepts may still be used to supplement other [Robotics Facility](/starcraft2/Robotics_Facility "Robotics Facility") or especially [Stargate](/starcraft2/Stargate "Stargate") play. ### Vs.[![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/e/e4/ProtossIcon.png/30px-ProtossIcon.png)](/starcraft2/File:ProtossIcon.png) Protoss\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Adept&action=edit§ion=7 "Edit section: Vs. Protoss")\ \] * The Adept opening is one of the reasons PvP is as volatile as it is; many PvP early games revolve around sneaking two Adepts into the opponent's main and killing probes. If left unchecked, these two Adepts can cause massive economic damage, potentially ending the game early. * However later in the game they do not necessarily make good harassment units, as they have inferior stats to [Zealots](/starcraft2/Zealot "Zealot") with [Charge](/starcraft2/Charge "Charge") in a runby, and the Adepts' ability micro becomes less useful. * While Adepts are strong against early Zealots and other light units, [Sentries](/starcraft2/Sentry "Sentry") with forcefield could be an alternative defence against Zealots. Sentries can guard the ramp and force favorable engagements. * The Stalker has higher damage, extra range, armored tag and the same build requirements as the Adept. This reduces the effectiveness of the mass Adepts with Resonating Glaives aggressive style which is more common in other matchups. Should one player choose Adepts, it would be trivial for the opponent to simply swap to Stalkers and regain the initiative. * As with other matchups, they fall off in the midgame as they are less effective than chargelots. ### Vs.[![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/9/94/TerranIcon.png/30px-TerranIcon.png)](/starcraft2/File:TerranIcon.png) Terran\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Adept&action=edit§ion=8 "Edit section: Vs. Terran")\ \] * Adepts can use the Psionic Shade to spot without going out of position and taking damage. For example, looking at the high ground of a Terran [Supply Depot](/starcraft2/Supply_Depot "Supply Depot") [Wall-In](/starcraft2/Walling "Walling") to scout addons. This is especially strong against a [Reaper](/starcraft2/Reaper "Reaper") and to an extent a [Reactor](/starcraft2/Reactor "Reactor") Hellion opening which both rely on the [Reactor](/starcraft2/Reactor "Reactor") . * Adepts have the potential to snowball in PvT against bio, particularly against drop play and/or when paired with the gas heavy [Phoenix](/starcraft2/Phoenix "Phoenix") . When faced with a hyper aggressive Terran who sends unrelenting [Medivac](/starcraft2/Medivac "Medivac") waves, feeding their army to the Phoenixes and Adepts in very small manageable chunks where the Protoss player can end up overwhelming the Terran at the midgame. ### Vs.[![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/d/d1/ZergIcon.png/30px-ZergIcon.png)](/starcraft2/File:ZergIcon.png) Zerg\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Adept&action=edit§ion=9 "Edit section: Vs. Zerg")\ \] * When combined with an early wall-in, Adepts are effective at preventing early [Zergling](/starcraft2/Zergling "Zergling") rushes due to their effectiveness against light armored units. * Adepts are used as a follow up scout after the [Probe](/starcraft2/Probe "Probe") , this ensures that a Protoss player has the ability to see the Zerg player's plans by way of the shade ability. Using Psionic Transfer gives the Adept the ability to scout and/or escape any Lings attempting to kill the Adept. This would also allow the Protoss player to potentially inflict early game damage by killing a few [Drones](/starcraft2/Drone "Drone") either by using the shade to dive into a mineral line or by using shade as an escape tool. * An early Adept push with [Resonating Glaives](/starcraft2/Resonating_Glaives "Resonating Glaives") , either rushed or after a [Stargate](/starcraft2/Stargate "Stargate") opening, may do tremendous economic damage to the Zerg. In the case the build forces out [Roaches](/starcraft2/Roach "Roach") , the Adepts should not commit to a straight up fight, but instead use their Shades to pressure the Zerg. This is because a follow up [Roach](/starcraft2/Roach "Roach") counter-push is potentially deadly to the Protoss. * A mid game Gladept [Immortal](/starcraft2/Immortal "Immortal") [Sentry](/starcraft2/Sentry "Sentry") timing is another way to use Gladepts. The ranged nature of the Adept allows it to attack units that have been blocked by Force Fields. * Upgrade changed to a health upgrade instead of providing bounce damage.
* Upgrade now adds 50 shields to Adepts.
* Adept can cancel the shade ability at any time. When you cancel, the shade disappears and you don’t teleport.
* Damage point reduced from 0.4 to 0.167 | | \[[hide](#)
\]\[[show](#)
\]Balance Update #2[\[4\]](#) | | --- | | * Weapon damage point changed from 0.4 to 0.167 | | \[[hide](#)
\]\[[show](#)
\]Patch 2.5.5 Balance Update #3[\[5\]](#) | | --- | | * Replace shield upgrade with an upgrade which reduces attack period by 45%
* Health reduced from 90/90 to 90/60 | | \[[hide](#)
\]\[[show](#)
\]Patch 2.5.5 Balance Update #4[\[6\]](#) | | --- | | * Adept health reduced to 60 shield and 80 health from 60 shield and 90 health. | | \[[hide](#)
\]\[[show](#)
\]Patch 2.5.5 Balance Update #6[\[7\]](#) | | --- | | * Adept shields increased by 10. | | \[[hide](#)
\]\[[show](#)
\]Patch 3.1.1 Balance Update[\[8\]](#) | | --- | | * Damage reduced from 10 (+13 light) to 10 (+12 light) | | \[[hide](#)
\]\[[show](#)
\]Patch 3.8.0 [\[9\]](#) | | --- | | * Shade vision reduced from 9 to 2. | | \[[hide](#)
\]\[[show](#)
\]Patch 3.12.0 Balance Update[\[10\]](#) | | --- | | * Maximum Health reduced from 80 to 70. | | \[[hide](#)
\]\[[show](#)
\]Patch 4.0.0 [\[11\]](#) | | --- | | * Shade sight increased from 2 to 4. | | \[[hide](#)
\]\[[show](#)
\]Patch 4.1.4 Balance Update [\[12\]](#) | | --- | | * Adepts will continue with their last issued command instead of stopping after using Psionic Transfer. | | \[[hide](#)
\]\[[show](#)
\]Patch 4.2.0 [\[13\]](#) | | --- | | * Adept attacks will now have orange projectiles once Resonating Glaives has been researched. | | \[[hide](#)
\]\[[show](#)
\]Patch 4.8.2 [\[14\]](#) | | --- | | * Gateway build time increased from 27 seconds to 30 seconds. Warp Gate cooldown remains unchanged. | | \[[hide](#)
\]\[[show](#)
\]Patch 4.11.0 [\[15\]](#) | | --- | | * Resonating Glaives reworked. Instead of increasing attack speed of the Adept by 45%, it will increase the attack speed of the Adept by 60% for 6 seconds after a completed Psionic Transfer. | | \[[hide](#)
\]\[[show](#)
\]Patch 4.11.3 [\[16\]](#) | | --- | | * Resonating Glaives upgrade effects reverted. The Resonating Glaives upgrade will now increase the attack speed of Adepts by 45%. | External Links\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Adept&action=edit§ion=12 "Edit section: External Links")\ \] ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ * [Legacy of the Void Beta Preview](http://eu.battle.net/sc2/en/blog/18291111) - The Adept was mentioned in the LotV Beta Preview as a new Protoss unit. Zerg](#Vs._Zerg) * [5 Quotes](#Quotes) * [6 Patch Changes](#Patch_Changes) * [7 External Links](#External_Links) * [8 References](#References) Description\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Adept&action=edit§ion=1 "Edit section: Description")\ \] ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- **Adepts** are "highly trained battlefield commanders", warped in at the [Gateway](/starcraft2/Gateway "Gateway") after the [Cybernetics Core](/starcraft2/Cybernetics_Core "Cybernetics Core") has finished. They were first introduced in [Legacy of the Void](/starcraft2/Legacy_of_the_Void "Legacy of the Void") . Despite their low rate of fire, Adepts can punch a hole through [Lightly](/starcraft2/Light "Light") \-armored targets. In addition, they can project a [Shade](/starcraft2/Psionic_Transfer "Psionic Transfer") of themselves, a controllable copy of the Adept that is immune but which exists for a brief time. Once this timer is up, the original Adept will teleport to the location of the shade, or the shade can be cancelled and preserve the location of the Adept. Due to the speed and immortality of the shade, this makes for an ideal scout. The ability can also be used for more offensive purposes. If the shade(s) are sent into the base of an opponent, it may require the opponent to split their army to deal with the possibility of the shade(s) expiring and the Adepts dealing damage. If Adepts are used for extensive damage-dealing, it may be desirable to research the [Resonating Glaives](/starcraft2/Resonating_Glaives "Resonating Glaives") upgrade from the Twilight Council, increasing Adept attack speed. Two defining features of developed armies in Starcraft are either they are extremely mobile but lacking power or powerful with less mobility. Two Stargate units the [Phoenix](/starcraft2/Phoenix "Phoenix") and [Oracle](/starcraft2/Oracle "Oracle") can harass where Adepts cannot, all three combined are even capable of defending almost all threats from both Terran and Zerg from the early to mid game. See Versus Protoss for why Adepts are not common there. Adepts have no anti-air attack and are commonly produced alongside [Stargate](/starcraft2/Stargate "Stargate") units like a few [Oracles](/starcraft2/Oracle "Oracle") and many [Phoenix](/starcraft2/Phoenix "Phoenix") . Phoenixes can control the opponent's air units, and their harassment, while also having the [Graviton Beam](/starcraft2/Graviton_Beam "Graviton Beam") ability to remove [Armored](/starcraft2/Armored "Armored") units into the air and leave the [Light](/starcraft2/Light "Light") units to be cleared up by the Adept's bonus damage. Most common against Zerg and Terran. Increases the Adept's shields by 50. | Competitive Use\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Adept&action=edit§ion=5 "Edit section: Competitive Use")\ \] ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- ### General\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Adept&action=edit§ion=6 "Edit section: General")\ \] * Adepts are fast and good at harassing workers, which have the light tag and take bonus damage. They can shade around to vulnerable parts of the mineral line. * They can be combined with other harassment units such as a [Warp Prism](/starcraft2/Warp_Prism "Warp Prism") or some [Oracles](/starcraft2/Oracle "Oracle") in the early game to be able to pressure and harass two locations at the same time. A Warp Prism also gives an early [Warpgate](/starcraft2/Warpgate "Warpgate") research timing for Adepts if the opponent has teched too hard or too greedy. * Compared to the [Stalker](/starcraft2/Stalker "Stalker") , the other ranged [Gateway](/starcraft2/Gateway "Gateway") unit, the Adept tends to do better in the early game with its bonus against light units and low gas cost, whereas the Stalker does better in the midgame because it is more durable and can hit air units, amongst other reasons. * For example, Adepts combine well with the [Sentry](/starcraft2/Sentry "Sentry") 's [Forcefield](/starcraft2/Force_Field "Force Field") ability for defense against Ground unit rushes, due to the Adept's lower gas cost. It may be possible to defend off of [Gateways](/starcraft2/Gateway "Gateway") alone, depending on the size of the ramp you wish to defend. This effect is enhanced when [Warpgate](/starcraft2/Warpgate "Warpgate") research is finished and was used in Wings of Liberty against a [Stalker](/starcraft2/Stalker "Stalker") \-based 4 Warpgate Rush to buy time for [Immortals](/starcraft2/Immortal "Immortal") . * However, Adepts still cost less gas than stalkers, and as always Adepts may still be used to supplement other [Robotics Facility](/starcraft2/Robotics_Facility "Robotics Facility") or especially [Stargate](/starcraft2/Stargate "Stargate") play. ### Vs.[![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/e/e4/ProtossIcon.png/30px-ProtossIcon.png)](/starcraft2/File:ProtossIcon.png) Protoss\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Adept&action=edit§ion=7 "Edit section: Vs. Protoss")\ \] * The Adept opening is one of the reasons PvP is as volatile as it is; many PvP early games revolve around sneaking two Adepts into the opponent's main and killing probes. If left unchecked, these two Adepts can cause massive economic damage, potentially ending the game early. * However later in the game they do not necessarily make good harassment units, as they have inferior stats to [Zealots](/starcraft2/Zealot "Zealot") with [Charge](/starcraft2/Charge "Charge") in a runby, and the Adepts' ability micro becomes less useful. * While Adepts are strong against early Zealots and other light units, [Sentries](/starcraft2/Sentry "Sentry") with forcefield could be an alternative defence against Zealots. Sentries can guard the ramp and force favorable engagements. * The Stalker has higher damage, extra range, armored tag and the same build requirements as the Adept. This reduces the effectiveness of the mass Adepts with Resonating Glaives aggressive style which is more common in other matchups. Should one player choose Adepts, it would be trivial for the opponent to simply swap to Stalkers and regain the initiative. * As with other matchups, they fall off in the midgame as they are less effective than chargelots. ### Vs.[![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/9/94/TerranIcon.png/30px-TerranIcon.png)](/starcraft2/File:TerranIcon.png) Terran\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Adept&action=edit§ion=8 "Edit section: Vs. Terran")\ \] * Adepts can use the Psionic Shade to spot without going out of position and taking damage. For example, looking at the high ground of a Terran [Supply Depot](/starcraft2/Supply_Depot "Supply Depot") [Wall-In](/starcraft2/Walling "Walling") to scout addons. This is especially strong against a [Reaper](/starcraft2/Reaper "Reaper") and to an extent a [Reactor](/starcraft2/Reactor "Reactor") Hellion opening which both rely on the [Reactor](/starcraft2/Reactor "Reactor") . * Adepts have the potential to snowball in PvT against bio, particularly against drop play and/or when paired with the gas heavy [Phoenix](/starcraft2/Phoenix "Phoenix") . When faced with a hyper aggressive Terran who sends unrelenting [Medivac](/starcraft2/Medivac "Medivac") waves, feeding their army to the Phoenixes and Adepts in very small manageable chunks where the Protoss player can end up overwhelming the Terran at the midgame. ### Vs.[![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/d/d1/ZergIcon.png/30px-ZergIcon.png)](/starcraft2/File:ZergIcon.png) Zerg\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Adept&action=edit§ion=9 "Edit section: Vs. Zerg")\ \] * When combined with an early wall-in, Adepts are effective at preventing early [Zergling](/starcraft2/Zergling "Zergling") rushes due to their effectiveness against light armored units. * Adepts are used as a follow up scout after the [Probe](/starcraft2/Probe "Probe") , this ensures that a Protoss player has the ability to see the Zerg player's plans by way of the shade ability. Using Psionic Transfer gives the Adept the ability to scout and/or escape any Lings attempting to kill the Adept. This would also allow the Protoss player to potentially inflict early game damage by killing a few [Drones](/starcraft2/Drone "Drone") either by using the shade to dive into a mineral line or by using shade as an escape tool. * An early Adept push with [Resonating Glaives](/starcraft2/Resonating_Glaives "Resonating Glaives") , either rushed or after a [Stargate](/starcraft2/Stargate "Stargate") opening, may do tremendous economic damage to the Zerg. In the case the build forces out [Roaches](/starcraft2/Roach "Roach") , the Adepts should not commit to a straight up fight, but instead use their Shades to pressure the Zerg. This is because a follow up [Roach](/starcraft2/Roach "Roach") counter-push is potentially deadly to the Protoss. * A mid game Gladept [Immortal](/starcraft2/Immortal "Immortal") [Sentry](/starcraft2/Sentry "Sentry") timing is another way to use Gladepts. The ranged nature of the Adept allows it to attack units that have been blocked by Force Fields.
